SEPARATION OF TIIE RULE 0F CHAIRMAN AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER

A separation of roles and powers between the Chairman and the Chief Executive Officer ensures an appropriate balance of power, greater accountability and increased capacity of the Board for independent decision making‘ The division of responsibilities between them are clearly established and agreed by the Board.

REVIEW OF DIRECTORS' INDEPENDENEE

Principle 2 “Board Composition and Guidance of this corporate governance report sets out the guidelines for the Nominating Committee's determination of a Director's independence on an annual basis.

BIREETURS'TIME COMMITMENTS

Factors such as multiple board representations are taken into consideration by the Nominating Committee when deciding whether a Director is able to devote sufficient time and attention to discharging their responsibilities adequately, Noting that the time requirement of each directorship varies, the Nominating Committee believes that limiting the number of directorships a Director can hold may be arbitrary. Instead, the Nominating Committee is provided by each of the Directors a confirmation of their ability to devote sufficient time and attention to the Company‘s affairs, having regard to all other commitments which they declare. The Nominating Committee is satisfied that all Directors have discharged their duties adequately from 1 January 2017 until the end of the financial year under review‘ and will continue to do so in the next financial year.
